data.title: Please adjust your website: It's not CET but CEST
data.meta_description: Ok, so after reading some informations for a few patch notes/maintenance announcements, I stumbled upon the issue that you address our CEST[Central European Summer Time, i.e. the daylight saving time] as CET[ Central Eur…
data.text:
Ok, so after reading some informations for a few patch notes/maintenance announcements, I stumbled upon the issue that you address our CEST[Central European Summer Time, i.e. the daylight saving time] as CET[ Central European Time, i.e. the regular time from last week of October till last week of March].

Examples:

Greetings, Saviors!

We would like to announce the details of our weekly maintenance. Make sure to check below for the maintenance schedule and patch notes.

Please note that other issues and bugs are also being worked on even if they are not mentioned below.

Maintenance Period

[EDT] 22:00 to 05:00 (May 15-16, 2017)

[EXTENDED][BRT] 23:00 to 08:00 (May 15-16, 2017)

[CET] 04:00 to 11:00 (May 16, 2017)

[SGT] 10:00 to 17:00 (May 16, 2017)

Greetings, Saviors!

We would like to announce the details of our weekly maintenance. Make sure to check below for the maintenance schedule and patch notes.

Please note that other issues and bugs are also being worked on even if they are not mentioned below.

Maintenance Period

[EDT] 01:00 to 05:00 (May 23, 2017)

[BRT] 02:00 to 06:00 (May 23, 2017)

[CET] 07:00 to 11:00 (May 23, 2017)

[SGT] 13:00 to 17:00 (May 23, 2017)

Greetings, Saviors!

We would like to announce the details of our weekly maintenance. Make sure to check below for the maintenance schedule and patch notes.

Please note that other issues and bugs are also being worked on even if they are not mentioned below.

Maintenance Period

[EDT] 01:00 to 05:00 (May 30, 2017)

[BRT] 02:00 to 06:00 (May 30, 2017)

[CET] 07:00 to 11:00 (May 30, 2017)

[SGT] 13:00 to 17:00 (May 30, 2017)

While some people might not confuse the times, it might produce a mistake as some European countries don’t have the daylight saving time [i.e. Iceland, Russia and Belarus] and people in the other European countries might actually think the maintenance starts an hour early.

Also,not everyone knows the different other timescales to come up with the correct time after addition or substraction of the specific hour differences.

It’s easy to fix, just write CEST instead of CET and the information is correct
